framework.utilities

Class BaseTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.utilities.BaseTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ControlTests

    public class BaseTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the base functionality for instantiating a thread safe web browser for a test. Tests should be able to run in parallel with no issues.
    Author:
    nvonop

    • Field Detail

      • driver

        public java.lang.ThreadLocal<org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver> driver
        A ThreadLocal instance of a WebDriver object. It should be thread safe and enable tests to run in parallel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseTest

        public BaseTest()

    • Method Detail

      • closeWebdriver

        public void closeWebdriver()
        This method closes the browser associated with the ThreadLocal WebDriver object. It also the WebDriver instance for the ThreadLocal value to null.

      • setLocalWebdriver

        public void setLocalWebdriver(java.lang.String browser,
                     java.lang.String version,
                     java.lang.String platform)
        This method initialises the ThreadLocal WebDriver object according to the supplied parameters to enable tests to run on a users local machine.
        Parameters:
        browser - This can be set to "chrome", "internet explorer" or "firefox"
        version - This should be set to reflect the browser required. It is only used when matching capabilities for a RemoteWebDriver object however.
        platform - This should be set to whatever platform the test is required to run on e.g. "WINDOWS", "MAC", "LINUX". It is only used when matching capabilities for a RemoteWebDriver object however.

      • setSauceWebdriver

        public void setSauceWebdriver(java.lang.String browser,
                     java.lang.String version,
                     java.lang.String platform)
        This method initialises the ThreadLocal WebDriver object according to the supplied parameters to enable tests to run on Sauce Labs cloud infrastructure.
        Parameters:
        browser - This can be set to "chrome", "internet explorer" or "firefox"
        version - This should be set to reflect the browser required. It is only used when matching capabilities for a RemoteWebDriver object however.
        platform - This should be set to whatever platform the test is required to run on e.g. "WINDOWS", "MAC", "LINUX". It is only used when matching capabilities for a RemoteWebDriver object however.

      • setRemoteWebdriver

        public void setRemoteWebdriver(java.lang.String browser,
                      java.lang.String version,
                      java.lang.String platform)
        This method initialises the ThreadLocal WebDriver object according to the supplied parameters to enable tests to run remotely on a grid of test machines.
        Parameters:
        browser - This can be set to "chrome", "internet explorer" or "firefox"
        version - This should be set to reflect the browser required. It is only used when matching capabilities for a RemoteWebDriver object however.
        platform - This should be set to whatever platform the test is required to run on e.g. "WINDOWS", "MAC", "LINUX". It is only used when matching capabilities for a RemoteWebDriver object however.

      • setWebDriver

        public void setWebDriver(java.lang.String browser,
                java.lang.String version,
                java.lang.String platform)
        This method provides a way of initialising a ThreadLocal WebDriver object in a consistent way regardless of where the test will run. The following system properties must be set to "true" or "false" for this method to function correctly: LOCAL_DRIVER, REMOTE_DRIVER, SAUCE_DRIVER. Setting one of the properties to "true" will ensure the ThreadLocal WebDriver object is initialised appropriately.
        Parameters:
        browser - This can be set to "chrome", "internet explorer" or "firefox"
        version - This should be set to reflect the browser required. It is only used when matching capabilities for a RemoteWebDriver object however.
        platform - This should be set to whatever platform the test is required to run on e.g. "WINDOWS", "MAC", "LINUX". It is only used when matching capabilities for a RemoteWebDriver object however.
